title: How to Identify and Tag Your Family Photographs With fotobounce

steps.headline: Download fotobounce.
steps.description: There is a version for Windows and one for Mac.

steps.headline: Download Adobe AIR.
steps.description: They are both free applications. They are both executable files and won't need a zip program to install them.

steps.headline: Point to your photo folder.
steps.description: fotobounce will 'ask' if you want to use My Pictures. If that is where your pictures are, then agree.

steps.headline: Wait.
steps.description: At this time, fotobounce will start scanning the folder (and folders within) for photos. It will take some time, so just step away from the program...for the moment.

steps.headline: Start identifying faces.
steps.description: The software will identify faces...some may, or may not, be actual faces. When you identify one, the program will search for other faces that might match.

steps.headline: Click on the 'pencil'.
steps.description: This is where you type in the name of the person in the picture.

steps.headline: Be sure that the eyes (cross hairs) are in the right place.
steps.description: This will help the software be more correct.

text: Download fotobounce. There is a version for Windows and one for Mac. Download Adobe AIR. They are both free applications. They are both executable files and won't need a zip program to install them. Start fotobounce.  Point to your photo folder. fotobounce will 'ask' if you want to use My Pictures. If that is where your pictures are, then agree. 'Train' the software.  Wait. At this time, fotobounce will start scanning the folder (and folders within) for photos. It will take some time, so just step away from the program...for the moment. Start identifying faces. The software will identify faces...some may, or may not, be actual faces. When you identify one, the program will search for other faces that might match. Click on the 'pencil'. This is where you type in the name of the person in the picture. Be sure that the eyes (cross hairs) are in the right place. This will help the software be more correct.
